meanings.definition: The act of entraining or the state of being entrained.
meanings.sent1: The entrainments of the dancers to the music were mesmerizing.
meanings.sent2: The entrainments of the wheels on the tracks created a rhythmic sound.
meanings.sent3: The entrainments of the children to the catchy tune made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: Her entrainments to the beat of the drum were flawless.
meanings.sent5: The entrainments of the waves crashing against the shore were calming.
meanings.sent6: In the parade, the entrainments of the marching band to the drumbeat were impressive.
meanings.sent7: The entrainments of the birds to the sunrise signaled the start of a new day.

meanings.definition: The process of synchronizing biological rhythms with external cues.
meanings.sent1: The entrainments of the body's clock to daylight help regulate sleep.
meanings.sent2: The entrainments of the plants to the changing seasons ensure their growth.
meanings.sent3: The entrainments of the cat to the sound of the can opener always made her hungry.
meanings.sent4: His entrainments to the city's hustle and bustle were swift and seamless.
meanings.sent5: The entrainments of the fireflies to each other's lights were a beautiful sight.
meanings.sent6: The entrainments of the bees to the flowers ensure pollination.
meanings.sent7: The entrainments of the athletes to the coach's whistle were perfectly timed.
